name: Bigquery Importer
description: Import data from any BigQuery query

options.placeholder: Select Google project to work with

private_settings.name: import_type
private_settings.title: Entity to import
private_settings.description: What do you want to import to Hull ?

private_settings.name: query
private_settings.title: Query
private_settings.description: The query that the connector will execute in Bigquery. Please paste a valid query that you have written and tested in Bigquery's editor.

private_settings.name: import_interval
private_settings.title: Import interval
private_settings.description: Define here the amount of time (in minutes) between imports.

private_settings.name: import_days
private_settings.title: Increment (in days)
private_settings.description: Define the number of days for the incrementation you want to use in your query.

settings_sections.title: Authentication
settings_sections.description: In order to authorize the connector to access your BigQuery project you need to provide a Service Account Key. Find out how to obtain it in the documentation.

settings_sections.title: Select project
settings_sections.description: Select the google project you'd like to work on. The connector will create jobs associated to this project.

settings_sections.title: Incremental queries
settings_sections.description: The connector can make a variable called 'import_start_date' available to use in your incremental query. If your SQL query does not use this variable at all, this setting has no effect.
